data.title: What is HTML?
data.description: HTML, or HyperText Markup Language, is the standard language used to create and design web pages and web applications.

items.description: Markup language for structuring web content.
HTML5 is the latest version of HTML, with new features and improvements.

basic_structure.title: Basic structure of an HTML5 document
basic_structure.description: The fundamental layout of an HTML5 document, including essential elements that provide structure and meaning to the content.

items.title: <html>
items.description: Root element containing all the page content.

items.title: <head>
items.description: Contains metadata like the title, links to styles, etc.

items.title: <body>
items.description: Contains the visible content of the webpage.

data.conclusion: Understanding HTML5 is crucial for web development, as it provides the basic structure for web pages and includes new features that improve both functionality and user experience.
